snippet: The scandal over global interest rates has states working to build a case for suing the nation’s largest banks.
abstract: Scandal over global interest rates has states working to build a case for suing the nation's largest banks; state officials are combing through investments trying to determine how much may have been lost due to suspected manipulation of the London interbank offered rate, or Libor, which is used as a benchmark for trillions of dollars of financial contracts worldwide.
lead_paragraph: The scandal over global interest rates has states working to build a case for suing the nation’s largest banks.

headline.seo: Banks Facing Suits as States Weigh Their Libor Losses
headline.main: Banks Face Suits as States Weigh Libor Losses
